article.title: Angular momentum evolution of stellar disks at high redshifts

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the vertical dashed line in each panel of Figure 1 represent?
choices: The completeness limit of the H160W magnitude.
The lower limit of the stellar mass used in the study.
The typical size of a galaxy at that redshift.
The boundary between star-forming and quiescent galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main purpose of Figure 2 in the context of the study?
choices: To show the distribution of galaxy sizes at different redshifts.
To identify and select star-forming galaxies for the analysis.
To demonstrate the accuracy of the photometric redshift measurements.
To compare the star formation rates of galaxies with different masses.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the blue solid line in the top panel of Figure 5 represent?
choices: The predicted size evolution of galaxies based on a constant circular velocity.
The best-fit power law for the observed size evolution of galaxies at a fixed stellar mass.
The evolution of the scatter in galaxy sizes at a fixed stellar mass.
The relation between galaxy size and dark matter halo mass.

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical property of a disk galaxy does Equation 2 primarily aim to model?
